intro: Cylindrolobus motuoensis, commonly known as the Motuo bellflower, is a rare and endemic species native to the Yunnan Province in China. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers and distinctive morphology. The plant typically grows in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to the cool, moist climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers are usually blue or violet in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
